title: Job 28:1
text: SURELY there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.

title: Job 28:2
text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.

title: Job 28:3
text: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

title: Job 28:4
text: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

title: Job 28:5
text: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

title: Job 28:6
text: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

title: Job 28:7
text: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:

title: Job 28:8
text: The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

title: Job 28:9
text: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.

title: Job 28:10
text: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

title: Job 28:11
text: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.

title: Job 28:12
text: But where shall wisdom be found?  and where is the place of understanding?

title: Job 28:13
text: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

title: Job 28:14
text: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.

title: Job 28:15
text: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

title: Job 28:16
text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

title: Job 28:17
text: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.

title: Job 28:18
text: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

title: Job 28:19
text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

title: Job 28:20
text: Whence then cometh wisdom?  and where is the place of understanding?

title: Job 28:21
text: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

title: Job 28:22
text: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

title: Job 28:23
text: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.

title: Job 28:24
text: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;

title: Job 28:25
text: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

title: Job 28:26
text: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

title: Job 28:27
text: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.

title: Job 28:28
text: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
